Nice production. But sounded like a fair amount of hiss in the background so intrigued what it was recorded with? Musically I think it would benefit from some more contrast musically. Seems pretty much the same all the way through. Definitely an indie pop vibe.

Thanks

Thank you for listening! This one #8217;s quite a weird one. It was just a bit of a weird jam messing about on keyboards (which I can #8217;t really play) and then picked up the guitar and the riff seemed to go nicely. The song structure is pretty much as per the demo/jam. I tried working it into a bit more of a traditional verse/chorus structure but that somehow lost the magic and looseness of the original version so just went with that in the end! First thought best thought (sometimes)!

Thanks for listening! As a general rule I like a bit of dissonance although probably first song I #8217;ve written with dissonant keyboards (usually guitars). I like you found it surprising - I agree not many songs I can think of with a similar sound or structure!
What kind of vibe are you shouting for?
Very dreamy and Eno-esque. You might want to consider making it longer for full marination purposes!
The music sounds way too bright. Try rolling off a lot of that top end and compressing the whole signal to make it sound a bit more like a record and a bit less like a home recording.
Like it. First part reminded me of Lemonjelly and the later half of Bon Iver. What was the sample taken from? Good work.
Thanks glad you liked it!
Thanks
Awesome thanks! If you like that please check out the album! :)
Awesome thank you for listening. If you #8217;d like to hear more please check out the album #8220;Fine Listener #8221; it #8217;s my third effort! :)
Everything
Thanks
Lol! Thanks
Like the song but I think it would benefit from mixing up the guitar sound a bit? What about some electric guitar to add some contrast/layers to the sound?
Sounds to sharp and home recorded to my ears. Try rolling off some of the high end with the eq and maybe some compression to make it sound a bit more like a pro recording?
Thanks for the feedback. Yep unfortunately loops are a necessity as this is all home recorded! But would be good to record with proper drums if the opportunity arose!
Like the music but to me it screaming out for a vocal. A good one could take it to a different level. Any plans to do that?
A strong vocal (I picture something vedder/Cobain like). And a chorus would obviously help focus attention. I like the guitar a lot though! #128077;
Thanks! I thought the vocals sounded more of a Strokes type vibe but I #8217;ll take Radiohead! :)
Like it. Keep up the good work. What did you use to create the video?

The sounds sound pretty cheesy. The piano sounds very not real. I #8217;d recommend trying sounds/instruments which don #8217;t show up the fact that they are low quality so badly. Go for synth sounds that people will not know what they are meant to sound like? I think the melody would work a lot better like this.
Doesn #8217;t really seem to go anywhere? But at the same time is busier than most ambient tracks. Sounds like it needs more.

If you want to get this sounding more like a proper record the drums need to be a lot higher in the mix. You need to compress the acoustic guitar. And also take out some of the top end with an eq. What did you use to record this?
Like the guitars but the drums sound very weak. Sounds to me like they should be far stronger and booming in the mix to support the guitar. Would also be great to here some vocals .
Maybe try drum samples rather than programming?

It #8217;s worth reading up on. But when you record something you #8217;ll be recording lots of info that is beyond human hearing (both at high and low end). Using a spectrum analyzer eq you see this pretty clearly and apply eq to remove. Result is a far more pro sounding recording. I use gb which has a pretty good eq.
Thanks for listening! What #8217;s you genre out of interest?
Thank you for listening. Well in my defence mine was done with GarageBand at home and they had Nigel Goodrich and their own state of the art studio! ;)-
Like the Nile Rodgers style guitar. Sounds like it #8217;s really missing some bass though?

Not quite my thing but the production sounds great. Reminds me a bit of the new Tame Impala stuff. Only suggested improvement is that the bass drum seems a little too boomy / obtrusive in the mix? Good work.
The music sounds like the wrong key for your voice? My suggestion would be to try it in a few different keys and see which fits better. You struggle with the low notes as it is.

Thanks! I will check these out!

So a bit more context. I #8217;m predominantly a guitarist but mess around on other instruments but play by ear. I #8217;m interested in learning a bit more about 3rds, 5ths etc and how and why different chords and scales go together. I figure that out now by ear but would be interesting to understand the theory. I also love reading hence my request for book recommendations. I #8217;ll check out those recommended thus far but all sound a bit music text book rather than a good book about music - if that makes sense? If you are interested in hearing what my music sounds like you can hear one of my albums here (Id classify it as indie alternative rock): https://open.spotify.com/album/3zCLi80ptEFvD0aQx6ZazN?si=p2DdGd9cREW5W4HCuF7HtQ https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/sets/days-seize-you
Thanks for the response. I #8217;m 43 so I do know what a library is! ;)- I also know there #8217;s a million books on the subject so am keen to get recommendations for good ones!
Thanks for the feedback! Glad you like it!
Thanks
One useful experiment would be to try recording a more intense version of this vocal. A good experiment for finding your voice.
Sounds great. Your description seriously under sells the song. Quality dream pop.

Starts off really well. But seems to lack a catchy chorus/hook. Have a feeling there may be some off notes in some of the guitar chords/keyboards at a couple of points. Hard to call as I #8217;m listening via iPhone speaker. But there seems to be occasional dischord that I #8217;m not sure is intentional? Typically dreampop is all about rich dreamy harmony.

Really like the opening. But seems to me like it should develop focus on the uptempo dances vibe. Would benefit from synths etc. I don #8217;t feel the heavy reverb guitar and space currently in the song serves the vocals that well. I think there #8217;s a gem of a uptempo party track here. But needs further development.
Thanks for taking the time to listen and provide feedback. This was a track off my first album and I agree with your thoughts. Musically would definitely benefit from an edit and more variation.
Was never 100% happy with this mix. Interested in hearing people #8217;s suggestions for how it could be improved? https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/its-hard-to-be-in-love

Please take a listen to my 3rd album #8220;Fine Listener #8221;. Music pulls together a range of influences that span indie, alternative, rock and electro. Welcome peoples thoughts and feedback: https://open.spotify.com/album/2ZoZPEztoj9bTXrg33OoAh?si=m0h4zqfEQsKJvLgsyCe56g https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/sets/fine-listener

Thanks for listening. So Novelistme is essentially me. That #8217;s a track off my second of three albums. Just working on album 4 right now. The albums are a pretty eclectic mix of musical styles but other songs with a #8220;grunge #8221; feel include: - Good Idea At The Time - Decompress My Mind - Come On In - Two Shots Without Reply - F*** Digital - Try Living - Sonic Youth On Bad Drugs - Was A Hound Dog
Like the guitar riff and the chorus. What did you use to record it? Only issue that jumps out is first verse when guitar drops out sounds very flat (as in no energy). But much to like.

Listened to the first track and liked it. Only comment is vocals sounded a bit too upfront and not really situated with the band. Thought might benefit also from some backing vocals / double tracking in places just to add a bit more texture / variety to the soundscape.
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks glad you like it!
I don #8217;t hear any rock?
Like the video. What kit did you use to produce it?

Can definitely hear the Grunge aesthetic. Sounds like a great production job (although listening on my phone so hard to tell any nuance). The only critical feedback is that the drumming sounds almost jaunty in conflict with the grunge vocals which suggest a deeper/darker vibe. Doesn #8217;t sit quite right to me.
Like the guitars. Would love to hear some Vocals. The drums however don #8217;t work for me. Would be great to hear some gentle playing in synch with the music.
Like the song, the production and the video which is pretty rare for here! What did you use to record it? And what did you use for the video?
Thanks
Thanks!

Like the song but don #8217;t think the vocals are as good as they could be. The verse vocal is very low and though well sung lacks dynamics. Maybe try a more animated / shorty vocal approach to inject some energy. Or maybe raising the key of the song to allow you to sing the verse in a higher register? Likewise the chorus vocal seems to be missing. Need to work on this and create something catchy that jumps out. Music and production sound good. The bones of a very good track.

There #8217;s a few points where the vocals are out of tune. Also whilst the song once it gets going is ok the intro with just the plain piano calls sounds very dull. What are you trying to say/achieve with the intro?

It sounds like a pretty straight live recording. Is it? If you are considering for a signal I #8217;d consider adding some overdubs to make it more sonically appealing and less straight. What about some overdubbed guitar with different effects in a few places? Subtle is good. But just something to pull the ear in. Also you might want to think about keyboard/synth sounds to add texture?

Like the song, guitars and vocal. Only thing I struggled with was the mix. Just sounded flooded with delay/echo/reverb which I found distracting and made the production sound a bit cheap. Would be interesting to hear a dry version. And then a version with just the bare minimum of effect.
Yep liked this. Really interesting production and vocals. Are you doing all of them? What #8217;s your approach to harmonies? Congrats!
Good guitar sound and build up. Not sure about the effect on the vocal. Not a big fun of the techno drums a bit monotonous. Couldn #8217;t really hear any climax or release or catchy chorus?

Like the basis of the song. Not 100% convinced by the production though. Drums, guitar and vocals sound very separate and not cohesive. Sounds a bit like the vocals need some of the high frequencies take out. Might also benefit from some musical embellishment to make a bit more interesting and add texture?

Yep. Just done at home on GarageBand! :) Thanks for listening! :) If you #8217;d like to hear more I #8217;ve done 3 albums to date and am working on 4th now - hopefully will finish that by the summer. Thanks. It was a bit of an experiment of a song as there #8217;s multiple different sections. Was trying to create something a little outside the normal verse/chorus structure. Glad you liked it! How many vocal parts in the finished version?
Thanks for listening. Which new stuff were you listening to? Good to hear production has improved over time! Keen to get feedback on all of it! :)
Thanks for the heads up
Awesome thanks for listening

The intro is way too long and not particularly interesting. Having said that was completely surprised and blown away when the song and singing starts after 40 seconds. My advice would be to get to that ASAP. I suspect most people would tune out well before then and miss the song proper!
Generally pretty good. Reminded me of Marc Bolan a bit. Was a bit confused by the drumming false start? I #8217;d suggest getting rid of that as it just seems a distraction to me.
Vocal reminds me of Thurston Moore which is a good thing in my book. Also liked the video work so congrats on that!
Liked the song and the video fits it really well. Recording sounds good. What did you use? And also to put together the video?

Awesome show real! Would love to see your take on one of my songs! Please take a listen and see if there are any that inspire you? I #8217;ve done 3 albums to date (working on 4th now). They are: 1) The Long Wait 2) Days Seize You 3) Fine Listener You can check them out here: https://open.spotify.com/artist/1x8JnJjZPlFO4UciBRXMQb?si=BmseL5DOSSGu7UQhKxydIQ https://soundcloud.com/novelistme Let me know your thoughts! :)
Np

Thanks for the feedback. Interesting point re hard panning or not. I #8217;ve taught myself mixing from reading online mainly. There doesn #8217;t seem to be any consensus on whether you should Hard pan or not? Any good sources you #8217;d suggest?
As long as the theme inspires good music that #8217;s what makes it interesting! Nice instrumentation. Would be interesting to hear where this goes.
Like the opening keyboard riff but was expecting the song to cut loose / explode at some point which it never really did.
Im not really hearing the rock?
Nice harmonies

Some interesting ideas here that held my interest. Is this all synth or is there live brass? The vocals worked nicely in some bits and just seemed plain out of tune in others which diminished the overall effect imho.

Really liked this. Only thing I didn #8217;t like was the Accoustic guitar. I think the song would benefit from having this removed or a lot less volume. Doesn #8217;t sit with the rest of the mix imho.
Liked the verse but seemed to completely lack a catchy chorus? Would be great to here that in the song. A bit more of a hook and sonic variation.

I think there #8217;s the basis of a good song here. Whilst there are some vocals I think it would benefit from some proper verse / chorus melody and words. Then you can spread out some of the musical ideas over a few more mins.

Thank you for listening and the positive feedback. If you are interested you can hear the rest of the album here: https://open.spotify.com/album/2ZoZPEztoj9bTXrg33OoAh?si=zZbG5Xl0R3-6GEkVa_CY9A https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/sets/fine-listener

Try this that I #8217;m pretty sure you won #8217;t have heard before! :) https://open.spotify.com/album/3zCLi80ptEFvD0aQx6ZazN?si=ybyPBHiGTtyK5XeT76rY7Q https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/sets/days-seize-you

Well the way I approach it is to start off with a interesting chord structure that #8217;s different to your verse and then just try improvising loads of different melodies over that chorus and see which one stands out catches your imagination?
Nailed the dream pop sound!
Yep the Song is lost in way too much distortion and reverb. Would be interesting to hear a dryer version as I think there could be a good song inside. Hard to tell at the moment!

Nice germ of an idea here. However what starts off nice gets a bit monotonous pretty quickly. Needs some more variation in melody and lyrics. Also musically the song doesn #8217;t seem to go anywhere? Would definitely benefit from a middle 8!

Any plans to put some vocals on the track? I think it would benefit. And potentially use the heavy bit at the end as a chorus? Some Nice guitar work here but I think some vocals would help make it more interesting.
Thank you! If you like that the rest of the album it #8217;s from is called Fine Listener if you want to hear some more!
Thanks for listening! :) The outro in this song was intended to provide that something new/different and a sense of crescendo. But appreciate may not have worked for you.

Liked the opening chord sequence but then it just seems to loop forever with little to no variation. Too repetitive for me. Also I #8217;m not a fan of auto tune so would be better to hear the original vocal imho.
Sounds good to me. Production works. Sound is interesting. Like the vocals - remind me a bit of Jesus And The Mary Chain. What were your influences for this track?

Lots of interesting ideas here although the end product sounds a bit messy to these ears. Interesting use of vocal multi layering. Really like the swell sounds - what did you use for those? An interesting song that sounds like it still needs a bit of refinement to fully realise its potential.
Thanks for listening and the ideas! :)
Like it! A very M83 vibe! What synths and recording software did you use out of interest? Good work keep it going!
Would like to here this with more uptempo/urgent drums. That #8217;s what I was expecting from the intro. But when the drums come in it kind of drags for me. Great vocals though.
Like the song and in particular the vocals. How did you record and mix them? Reminds me a lot of Whitney. I can hear they are at least double tracked. Is one doing harmonies or....?
Cool. Agree with you. Thanks for listening! :)

Thanks for the comments. The drums are loops so unfortunately not much opportunity to mix them up other than cutting up and splicing which is tricky. But agree that some movement on percussion would definitely be good. Like your comment on textures and will give that some thought! Thanks for listening! :)
It #8217;s a drum loop I purchased #128077;
Will take a listen to jimmyeatsworld. Thanks for listening #128077;
Cool will check it out #128077;
Definitely interesting. Seems more jazz than alternative rock though? Some great musicianship. But no discernible hooks or stand out melody. Depends what you are shooting for?

Yep the music is pretty solid but I agree the vocals are pretty awful. I #8217;d try and find someone on here to collaborate with. I #8217;d imagine there #8217;d be lots of vocalists interested in putting some vocals to that?

Good production work. In terms of arrangement the way it starts with #8220;not going to be your fool #8221; kind of lost me after about 20 seconds. All I could think was where is this going if this is the hook? But then the when the music changes its kind of nice but there #8217;s just no tension or build up. I #8217;d try and reverse it start with the 2nd bit and build anticipation for #8220;not going to be your fool #8221;. And also I #8217;d try and make that stand out a bit more with background vocals or some other musical element to distinguish it from the other bit. Good work. :)
Many thanks! Love Can and Sonic Youth! :)
Thanks. I just sent a cd to Steve Lamacq!
Thank you
Thank you glad you like it! :)
Thanks for listening! :)

As the other comments state this is clearly in the grunge style. So if that #8217;s what you are aiming for a good success. From a recording perspective the soundscape sounds a bit dull. Is there just one guitar and vocal? You could definitely generate more interest in the mix by double tracking and varying up the sounds. Some harmonies on the vocals would also help. Not sure if you #8217;ve heard Kurt Kobains vocals isolated but they sound pretty amazing and are made up of several different layers.
You must be able to hear that guitar is so out of tune?

First 15 seconds sounded like a million other punk songs but after that started to get interesting. Not sure this is the finished article but it #8217;s headed somewhere interesting. Have you heard Captain Beefheart? Worth listening to for some inspiration! :)

Quite different. Starts sounding like classic 80 #8217;s cheese and then gets super heavy. Not two styles I #8217;ve really heard together before but kind of unique because of it. If that #8217;s what you were going for I #8217;d say you #8217;ve pulled it off well!
Thanks!

Thanks for the feedback! The musical idea behind the song was to see how many different musical ideas I could meld together around what #8217;s basically the same pattern/progression. Glad you liked it!

I quite like it. Sounds fresh and original. I #8217;m trying to figure out whether it #8217;s mostly improvised or you completely intended to play that way? The rhythmic dislocation reminds of beefheart. Not sure there #8217;s enough here to make me want to keep coming back to the song (like Sufjan does) but interested to hear more! :)
Pleasant enough but not really my thing. However the voice and quality of recording stand out. How was this recorded?

I like the vibe of the song. Some good ideas in the song but sounds like it needs to be worked on a bit more - a tad too repetitive for me and not sure there #8217;s much of a progression to hold interest throughout. The combination with the video is strangely eery!
Impressive work! It sounds like upgrading from GarageBand to logic is worth the money!
Glad you liked it. Thanks for listening. Big fan of Beck but tend to think he #8217;s more dancey than Rock orientated?
Thanks for listening. Glad you liked it!
Interesting. The guitar riff sounds like the police and the vocal melody very grunge. Not two things you usually hear together! Are you using auto tune on the vocal?
Yep definitely not alternative rock
Interesting. Not many tracks go from Metal heavy to almost pop! Not really for my musical taste but seems well done. Interesting to see how it #8217;s received?

Production sounds a bit cheesy. Unclear if the song is meant to be original or a bit of a pastiche. Reminds me a lot of flight of the concords comedy songs. Maybe try experimenting with different sounds? More organic? Or more extreme electronic. Sounds very safe at the moment.
Thank you! Will give it a go. Just wanted to avoid tieing people to one music platform!

Reminds me a bit of animal collective in a good way. Think it would benefit from some electro backgrounds as the constant chord backing gets a bit wearing. Needs more texture to pull your interest in and keep it. But like the originality of the vocal melodies. Potentially do more with them? Delay/reverb?
Like the track but it #8217;s screaming out for some vocals!
Intro too trudging and monotonous for me.

Great contrasts here and love the electronic sounds. As I first listened to it I thought you were just shooting for a retro vibe all the way through. In which case when the drums came in they sounded a bit jarring. But then when the synths came in it made sense. Would still like to hear a version with more retro drums until the drop! But Great work and inventive video.
Thanks it #8217;s a picture from the a Stone Roses gig at Finsbury Park took on my iPhone! :)
Thanks for the feedback! :)
Thank you! :) If you are interested in hearing more just search Novelistme on Spotify etc. :)

Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! This is actually an older track I wrote and I think could definitely benefit from some better EQ and mastering I think. So 100% agree with you. I #8217;ve just finished my 4th album which should be #8220;released #8221; in the next month or so. All my stuff is on Spotify under Novelistme if you are interested. Thanks again for taking the time to share your comments. #128077;

Thanks for listening. In terms of influences/inspirations I remember coming up with the main riff which struck me as really pretty strange/unique. I don #8217;t know the theory behind the notes but sounded pretty psychedelic to me so then built the rest of the song up around the riff trying to make it as psychedelic as possible. The song sounds quite unlike anything else I #8217;ve written and I like it for that reason! :)

Hi thanks for listening and the very considered response! In terms of hard panning bass left this was something I did on this album (like most 60s records) but have since reverted to centering it. I #8217;m a big Pavement fan so that influence probably snuck through. I don #8217;t think there #8217;s actually any panning going on. I think what you are referring to is two guitars in left and right channel slightly out of phase with each other which gives that effect. Melodically I guess the vocal doesn #8217;t move much. But I guess I see it as the constant that the rest of the sound weaves around. As the song is pretty short I don #8217;t think it #8217;s too much of a problem but if it stretched to 3 mins plus would definitely drag. Thanks again for taking the time to share your thoughts! :)

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Hard Times
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/5OTXxutKnMlkZKnMAojaHc?si=2qV9avCvTE2fE0_TfEgjaA https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/01-hard-times https://youtu.be/Z_XPHUUoFEo

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Hard Times
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/5OTXxutKnMlkZKnMAojaHc?si=2qV9avCvTE2fE0_TfEgjaA https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/01-hard-times https://youtu.be/Z_XPHUUoFEo

The vocal wasn #8217;t quite what I was expecting. I think there #8217;s the basis of a good song here. However I think if your going to do a proper version of this then the versus need to have a lot more going on in them. The drums are very sparse, the guitar very basic chords and the bass just following the guitar pretty exactly (and pretty quiet if it #8217;s there at all). Think you need to add some counter melody or something else to engage the listener.

Drums sounded great. Effects on vocals sound terrible imho. Song seemed to lack any noticeable chorus as far as I could make out? Some nice sounds going on here but sounds like someone trying to find a melody rather than a finished song?

Intrigued as to what your influences are on this song? It sounds pretty unique which is obviously a good thing. Also trying to figure out the point if the voice over stuff at the start? Just seems a massive distraction that #8217;s been bolted on. But suspect I may be missing some important point?

Any song that mentions Captain Beefheart gets my vote. Only criticism is some of the chord progressions are a bit over familiar. The chords in what I think is the chorus sound very similar to Stiltskin Inside. Would love to hear some less conventional instrumentation like pavement or sonic youth.
Strong vocals and hits the reference points you mentioned 100%. Interested your hear what the full band sound is like?
Strong vocals and production although a little RAWK for my taste but sounds pretty damn good for a first attempt.

WRITING.TITLE: "subject250" the new album by Novelistme is released today. Please check it out! Here #8217;s the first track. Welcome your thoughts and feedback!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening. All done with GarageBand at home. I #8217;ve learned a bit about production simply through reading a couple of books and YouTube videos. Glad you like it!
It would be good to hear a track of yours with maximum weirdness/esotericness! Just as an experiment! :)

That #8217;s pretty cool. Like the multi-screen video. Would be interesting to hear what the studio recording would sound like. And how you build out the sound and sonic landscape with over dubs etc. You can hear my best efforts here - quite a different sound to you guys but still guitar driven! https://open.spotify.com/album/1UHtp6lU5FU5ElI69CjQYP?si=pro9NJPYQwaa9K3_ZQP_yA

WRITING.TITLE: "subject250" the new album by Novelistme. Please check it out! Strong Britpop influences!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for the feedback! Glad you liked it!
I hope that means you like it? Either way thanks for listening! :)
Think it would benefit from drums and potentially some other sonic colours to make it sonically interesting.
Have you considered music for kids/small children? I suspect that #8217;s a very lucrative market and you have that bright purity of sound thing down. Might be an interesting diversion?
Like the originality of the chords. Was expecting something ambient so was pleasantly surprised when the chords came in. Interesting stuff.

Musically sounds like pretty flat out 80s/90s rock which isn #8217;t usually my thing. Is that what you are shooting for? However kept listening as I liked the video and the fact that from the video it seems you guys are doing this a bit tongue in cheek?

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Problem - 2nd track from my new album subject250. Keen to get people #8217;s thoughts and feedback on the song, what bands you think it sounds like (always interesting to hear) and the production? Thanks!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening and glad you liked it! The rest of the album is here FYI: https://open.spotify.com/album/1UHtp6lU5FU5ElI69CjQYP?si=pro9NJPYQwaa9K3_ZQP_yA
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! Will have to go back and take a listen to FF!

Liked both the song and the video (good use of a drone)! Only criticism would be the one riff running all the way through might be a bit much. Would have perhaps liked the chorus to PDT more and the riff drop out. Would be interesting to hear that version to compare.
Sounded very Foo Fighters to me so I #8217;m guessing that #8217;s the sound you are going for. The video looked very professional if you did this yourself? Was the song studio or home recorded?

Found the song interesting. There #8217;s the germ of something here I like. The vocal melody is quite strange/unique in parts. The guitar effect sounds a bit too washed out and flooded in reverb. Would be good to hear a dryer version of the song. With some additional refinement think you could have something pretty cool here. :)

WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/0DITNgWaLUa22BQEVqafms?si=S52OGqQfQGSNfW2Rd2qKRw https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/04-you-come-at-tangents-1 https://youtu.be/G10haEGAvbo

Nice psychedelic vibes. Pleasing melody and seems pretty well produced. The one bit I didn #8217;t like was the single guitar break. Thought the riff was a bit unimaginative compared to the rest of the song. Also seems like the song should go/transition somewhere else musically rather than just fade out at the end?

Pleasant melody. Seems a lot of hiss and background noise which allied with the digital drumbeat make this sound a demo rather than a finished recording. What are you using to record and mix? Could definitely benefit some improvement there. I #8217;d definitely drop the digital beat.
Solid acoustic number. Do you do any full band stuff? Would be interesting to hear? How was this recorded?

WRITING.TITLE: If you like Pavement you may like this: Novelistme - You Come At Tangents
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/0DITNgWaLUa22BQEVqafms?si=S52OGqQfQGSNfW2Rd2qKRw https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/04-you-come-at-tangents-1 https://youtu.be/G10haEGAvbo
Some really nice bits to this. Vocals nice. Tune nice. Washed out guitars. Not sure about the intro. And the basic drum pattern is to in your face and repetitive imho. But other than that good work!

First listening to it when you first hear the chord progression I had low expectations. But then what you do with that is really quite something. All the little touches and flourishes paint a great audio picture. And the vocals sound awesome. What did you use to record? And how did you do the vocals?

Some good sounds in a ride, my bloody valentine type way. Suggested improvements would be 1) I don #8217;t like the abrupt intro - not really in keeping with the vibe. 2) You might want to try less reverb on the vocal. The whole thing sounds a little too washed out at the moment? Be interested in hearing a revised mix.

Like the guitars at the start but for me the drums and vocal don #8217;t live up to the promise of the rest of it. The drums are a bit too basic and trudging. I think there #8217;s a lot of promise. Would be cool to hear a bit of a reworking!

Reminds me a lot of DIIV. I #8217;m presuming the drums are programmed? Think it would definitely benefit from live drums - would add a bit of dynamics which I think it lacks a bit at the moment. But great work over all!
Good song, good vocals and production. Interested to hear how you recorded the vocals and how you mixed them? Good work!

Thanks for listening and the feedback! I did try various mixes with less drums but they lost the energy of this one - although I know what you mean. Probably a limitation of using GarageBand for everything. Pretty sure there is reverb on the guitar. Was going for something punk so avoided synths on this (although do use them on other stuff I #8217;ve done).

Thanks for listening and the feedback. Would have liked to have a slightly different beat for the chorus but limited to the loop I was using. Did try a few guitar lines in the chorus but wasn #8217;t happy with them. Wanted to go for a punk / shouty feel so didn #8217;t try any background vocals.
Like your tip on the buses. Will have a play with that. Thanks.
Awesome thanks for the positive feedback! Glad you liked it! :)

Started off like a very run of the mill acoustic song albeit with some good vocals and great harmonies but got a lot more interesting when the drums kicked in and the vocal changed. Might be better to start with that as imho it grabs the attention way better? Also not sure how this was recorded? Drums seem very low in mix. And although I #8217;m only listening on my phone everything seems to be flooded in reverb?
Not usually a fan of plain acoustic stuff (unless your Bon Iver or Nick Drake) but really liked this to my surprise. I think I #8217;m large part due to the vocals. Really great voice! #128077;
Great music but really want to hear some vocals and give this the full song treatment.

Reminds me a lot of Ariel Pink. Not usually my thing but kind of liked this? Sounds like you are using a vocoder on this? Usually hate that but seems quite subtle here and caught my interest. Do you use guitars as well as synths?

Great song and video. I #8217;d be interested to hear how this was recorded? In a studio or at home? Sounds quite a live recording. Good work keep it up!

Have to admit the basic slow guitar arpeggios at the start almost lost my interest but then as other things kicked in sounded a lot better. I liked what was happening with the vocal but not what sounded like the digitisation of the voice. Think it could be improved further by taking it in even more of a My Bloody Valentine direction.

Sounds very washed out. I suspect as a result of too much reverb, delay and distortion. I think there #8217;s a good song here. Would be interesting to hear a completely clean and dry version. And maybe some synths playing the guitar riff you have sitting under the vocal.

Sounds very good. Reminds me a lot in style of Cake #8220;Going the distance #8221;. My only criticism/suggested feedback would be to perhaps shorten the intro and get into the song quicker. I almost switched off as I just thought the track was going to consist of the bass riff doubled on guitar. And it does so much more! Would be cool to hear that intro as a M8 instead as you have people #8217;s attention by then anyway. Good work! What did you use to record it?

Can hear definite Pavement vibes to this. Like the vocals. The drums I find a bit irritating but I #8217;m guessing that #8217;s kind of the point. It would be cool to hear something a little bit more orthodox but with that off kilter vibe.

The music sounds like it #8217;s shooting for Nirvana but somehow lacks the catchy melody of Kurt Cobain and the drums seem to plod rather than drive/explode. Vocals remind me of the racinteurs. But the track shows promise. How was it recorded? My recommendation would be to try and work harder on a more energetic rhythm track and develop the melody a bit more (potentially with harmonies - Kurts use of harmonies and double track was crazy).

Great track and video. Would be interested to hear who your main influences were, how you recorded it (in a studio or at home - sounds very pro) and put together the video (is it stick video edited together or did you shoot some or all of it)? Anyway great work!

Nice job. Like the main guitar riff and the vocal although the production doesn #8217;t sound quite finished? I think it would benefit from proper drums - at the moment there seems to just be a very minimal beat keeping time? Not sure if that #8217;s a artistic choice or necessity? Do you have any other music online?

The verse reminded me of green day. Musically the repeated 3 chords could do with something else to hold the interest. Some kind of alternate melody line on guitar? The chorus is interesting but somewhat loses the momentum of the verse. Sounds well recorded. Be interested to hear what sound you guys are shooting for and how you recorded this?

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Running Interference
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/27WzbMwrQEYiY5nlabrKhX?si=mxBmdDB7Ra2WRAz6Sutb_Q https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/11-running-interference https://youtu.be/lj0HWTtlslU
Good track and great video. Reminds me a lot of the Killers / Editors. How was this recorded and did you do the video yourselves or get some pro help?

Hey good work. Guitar and instrumentation sound to me like pure early Tame Impala. In terms of production the drums sound overtly live - assuming you didn #8217;t close mic each of the drums? I think the vocals need a bit of work. They sound near spoken and lack the energy of the rest. Partly due I think to the fact they are in such a low register. Might be worth trying the song I #8217;m different keys to allow you to sing rather than speak a bit more? Just some ideas to play around with! What did you use to record it?

Sounds interesting and original. From a production perspective I #8217;ve assuming you haven #8217;t #8220;mastered it #8221;? Sounds like there #8217;s a lot of high frequencies in the account is that could done with some taming / compression. Would be worth playing with to get more of a professional sounding product. But what you have is a great basis.

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Running Interference
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/27WzbMwrQEYiY5nlabrKhX?si=mxBmdDB7Ra2WRAz6Sutb_Q https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/11-running-interference https://youtu.be/lj0HWTtlslU

There #8217;s obviously no right or wrongs but if you want it to #8220;sound like a record #8221; or like tunes on the radio everything has some level of compression (and also people typically roll off the high end that goes beyond human hearing on an eq). Have a play around with it and see what #8217;s right for you!

Liked the music and the video but struggled with the vocal. Normally I don #8217;t mind punk / shouty singers but something about this vocal didn #8217;t sit well for me. Also mystified by the T-Rex reference! Can #8217;t hear any T-Rex similarities!
Is this recorded live? Would be interesting to hear a higher quality studio version.

Thanks for listening and your considered comments. I know what you mean. This is actually the last song off my latest album and is intended as a short throw away bit of fun. In the days of CD #8217;s it would probably have been a hidden track. But they don #8217;t really work in the streaming age. In the context of the whole album I also try in several places to get away from traditional verse chorus structures. Hopefully in that context the track makes a bit more sense? If you get a chance to listen to the whole thing would be great to hear your thoughts? :)

What #8217;s a vocal leveller? A compresser?
Not really my thing but sounds very professionally done. How did you record it? What kind of influences / sound are you going for?

Wasnt sure about this to start with but definitely grew on me. The drum on the verse sounded very strange but I #8217;m guessing that #8217;s intentional. Can definitely hear the foals influences particularly on the bit with 2 guitars riffing (which went on a bit imho). Would be good to hear a bit more energy explode in the song and vocal to give a bit more dynamics. But would be interested in hearing more!

I think there #8217;s something I like here but the production sounds too messy to be sure. The vocal is completely lost. Might be worth reviewing the EQ of your other tracks to make room for them so they can cut through. At the moment the guitars dominate everything too much - and I like loud guitars!

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Any The Wiser
WRITING.TEXT: https://open.spotify.com/track/22k4pSMUaDt8qd1RefYgjQ?si=GJvmc6t2Sm6U4fpGXYaa6g https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/13-any-the-wiser https://youtu.be/OSoSuv3O6Kc
Awesome thanks! Yep this one is intended as a bit of a throwaway hidden track on the album - although in the age of streaming you don #8217;t really have hidden tracks these days!
Gotcha thanks

Thanks for listening and the considered comments! The guitar reminded me a lot of Blur but I now you #8217;ve said it I can definitely hear some Strokes vibes. :) Can #8217;t remember if I did use a parallel compressor? If I did it was on the whole track and not the drums. Do you use that a lot on drums?

Yep definitely Blur inspired guitars rather than singing. This is indeed me. Love Damon #8217;s vocals but my voice just doesn #8217;t sound like that. Interestingly you are not the first to say my vocals remind them of Josh Homme. Particularly on some of my rockier stuff. Where can I find your stuff to take a listen?

Thanks will check it out. That track was actually included as a kind of hidden, throw away last track to the album. I kind of like it #8217;s whimsical, lightness. In the context of the album I think it makes a bit more sense. If you like Rockier stuff then the album #8216;Days Seize You #8217; is more down that road whereas the last 2 are a bit more eclectic. In terms of Josh Homme the song that drove a lot of QOTSA comparisons was one I wrote called #8216;It #8217;s Hard (To Be In Love) #160; #8216;. Blur, Suede and Radiohead probably influence most of the stuff I write.

Just had a listen and not at all what I was expecting! Vocals sound quite grunge, more synth than I was expecting, guitars quite Rocky, and the single has an Indian drone vibe to it. From a production point of view I think it could be much improved by reviewing the EQ range of all the instruments. At the moment the instruments seem to be tripping over each other. Would be worth playing with. I #8217;d also make the drums louder - although if you refine the EQ this may have the same effect. But good work!
CD Baby. An album costs something like 70 to distribute and they put it everywhere (iTunes, Spotify etc).

Very polished recording. Did you do this in a studio or is it home recorded? Guessing the former? Would be intrigued to hear what kit you used if the latter? Good work!
Thought the music was great but the vocal didn #8217;t work for me. Would be great to hear a vocal with a bit more melody to do justice to the music. What was this recorded with out of interest?

Really liked the music but found the vocal a bit problematic. I #8217;m listening to it on my phone so a bit hard to be exact but i think the problems with the vocal are threefold 1) it #8217;s flat in places 2) too much reverb (swamps the track are times) and 3) I think it needs some of the low end cut from it. The music reminds me of the band No Age. Have heard their stuff? If not suggest you give it a listen as it sounds like what you are aiming for! Good work. With some rework of the vocal it could be great imho.

Wasn #8217;t sure at the start but the song yelled me in. Reminds me of Japanese Breakfast a bit. Interested to hear how this was recorded and what kit you used?
What Grammy did you win? Production sounds very good! Was this professionally recorded in a studio with a producer? The song itself didn #8217;t move me in a big way but I appreciate the craft.

Sounds like the kind of stuff I #8217;d like but hard to make out with the sound quality. I #8217;m presuming this is a live recording? Would be good to hear a version with studio production values. Like the energy and keen to hear more .

Thanks :)

Nice music but screaming out for vocals! What did you use to record this? The recording sounds very live? Not sure if you #8217;ve looked into mastering? Sounds like the track (particularly the guitars) could benefit from some compression.

There #8217;s parts of this that work quite well and other bits that don #8217;t. Some of the vocal sounds out of tune. One idea for resolving that might be to record the vocal listening to more traditional instrument backing purely to be able to clearly hear the chords and what goes better. The synth pads are so washy and light I think they make it hard to judge notes and the key etc. Also you might want to try playing with reverb, delay and compression on the vocal. Typically you want the vocal situated in the mix. At the moment the vocals sound very dry (no effects) whilst the music sounds like it has quite a lot. Try finding a middle ground between the two. Hope that helps give you some ideas? Keep up the good work! :)

Like the music. Reminds me a lot of tame impala. However I struggle with the vocal. The way it #8217;s mixed I don #8217;t think helps. But the voice seems to struggle with the highs and not be that comfortable with the lows. Might be worth double tracking the vocal to cover a bit of the fragility (used by tame impala a lot). Might also be worth trying the song in different keys to see if that might be more comfortable for the singer? Good work keep it up!

Thank you :)

Great recording. Seems to capture the laidback dream pop vibe really well. And the video is equally well done. It seems to capture the child like innocence of the song really well. What did you use to record the song? And how long did the video take?

Musically a good song. Production wise I think could be improved a lot. Main issues I hear are the drums are way too quiet. Secondly the vocals sound like they are recorded entirely on their own with a completely different reverb to everything else. This results in the vocals not be #8220;situated #8221; in the track. 9 times out of 10 you want to be able to shut your eyes and picture the music in the same sonic space in front of you. As If a band was playing in front of you. The current mix does not so that for me. However can be very easily remedies! :) Would be interesting to hear a remix fixing those issues! :)

Good song and great mix. Like the way the vocal is split I think between central channel and right speaker? How does the right speaker vocal differ from the central one? Sounds like a lot less treble but are there other conscious effects? Anywhere like your work. Congrats!

Thanks! :)

Congrats on the song and the mix. Both sound very accomplished. Reminds me of Davendra Bernhardt and Ariel Pink a bit. Would be interested to hear what you used to record this? But great work keep it up!

First of all I probably wouldn #8217;t name the genre of this as soft rock as that to me seems a bit of a dead genre. Having said that this 80s sound definitely has a bit of momentum these days with artists like Ariel Pink becoming known for it. Although it #8217;s a bit tounge in cheek (I think). Also to get that retro sound you might want to try rolling off some of the top end a bit on your eq? From a song perspective I thought the start was weak (I almost switched off) but the track got better and better as it went on. So you might want to try and change the start so it #8217;s a bit more attention grabbing? But good work!

Not my kind of song but can appreciate the production of the track which sounds crazy. Are those real strings? If not what did you use for that sound? Would be interesting to hear how this was recorded as sounds very professional.

Great first effort. Something strangely addictive about the tune. Although the recording sounds a bit noises? Did you record the guitar with a mic? What application were you using?

Not sure I #8217;d classify this as acoustic rock? Can #8217;t hear any acoustics and it #8217;s definitely not rock? Not really my thing but it sounds like what #8217;s getting played on the radio these days. Clearly singer can sing and seems well produced. Was this done at home or in a studio?

Sounds pleasant enough but don #8217;t get the 90s reference? The drums are Pure 80 #8217;s and the dream pop vibe guitars are the kind of dream pop sound that indie music has been awash with the last decade. 90 #8217;s indie for me is either grunge, slacker (pavement, sonic youth) or britpop. This is not any of those styles. Be interested in why you think it is 90s? Either way good work but I think describing/labelling this differently may serve you better.

Pretty much all of those are influences on my music. If you are interested please check out Novelistme. The most recent album is called subject250. Links here: https://open.spotify.com/album/1UHtp6lU5FU5ElI69CjQYP?si=zLSz7F3NTHW4VKTqALZYaA https://soundcloud.com/novelistme/sets/nozeit https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=OLAK5uy_n6IZSEPMfsFi6oUxr0_Pk6TJOKmLU4MPE

Lots to like here. Particularly the great voice and pretty guitar. But somehow the song doesn #8217;t work for me. Seems very repetitive from the outset and doesn #8217;t really pull you in. I think part of this may be the drum loop. Given your sound I #8217;d perhaps go for programmes beats vs this live drum loop and put in some variation. Also maybe try and add in some element of build earlier in the track? Liked the M8 but was desperate for a change by the time that came along. Lots of talent here so please keep it up!

Love the main riff. Sounds Pure Captain Beefheart which is a pretty rare sound to hear on IMF. Not usually a fan of spoken vocals but didn #8217;t mind this when it got going. The chorus didn #8217;t really give me what I was looking for but loved the second verse when it just drops to drums. Very inventive. Good work and intrigued to hear more. I #8217;m presuming this is a band? How is it recorded? In studio?
Strongest thing here is the vocal. Intrigued to hear how this was recorded and any tricks you use when recording/mixing the vocal? Good work.

Something I hear I really like but the sound of the acoustic guitar I find really grating. Now I am listening on a phone but it sounds very thin and doesn #8217;t sit well in the mix. Sounds like the sound of an electro acoustic? If it is I think it could be much improved by just using a traditional acoustic and mic. But good work!

WRITING.TEXT: Wow this is pretty impressive. Took a listen and at first thought this was just your typical acoustic stuff that gets posted on here. The basic bass drum reminded me of some tracks I #8217;ve recorded where I just use that thump to keep time. But then you have that percussion that comes in to make things rhythmically more interesting. But the chorus is awesome. The music just goes BiG but blends really nicely with the song. Intrigued how this was recorded. The blend of sounds into one organic whole is done really well. If I had a suggestion to make it better it would be to perhaps lose or change that simple bass thump at the start. My only concern would be that the really basic start of the song under sells what #8217;s to come so many people might switch off before then. Nice account if songs are plentiful but what your doing here is a lot more! Congrats!

Not a massive fan of the vocal style (but that #8217;s just a personal taste thing) but love the drums and the music to this. The video is also very cool. All looks and sounds super professional. How was it recorded? Keep up the good work.

At first wasn #8217;t sure about the vocal but that grew on Me throughout the song. Really liked some of the guitar work, and the music kept interesting throughout. The one thing that kept bugging me was can the singer do falsetto? Might be good for some harmonies here and there and also to add a bit more dynamics? But good work really like this.

WRITING.TITLE: So consensus last week was the track generally reminded people of Beck, Eels, The Beta Band and Tobacco. What about this track?

WRITING.TEXT: If people like it.
Thanks for the feedback. Most people don #8217;t seem to like the outro as it #8217;s a little unexpected and dischordant. But I like it for that exact same reason! :)

The production values on both the music and video seem very good but I think this may have been mis labeled as I #8217;d never call this alternative rock? Not my type of music but I can see it probably having a strong audience out there.
Like the tune. Would be cool to hear it in a proper song. What guitar is that?

Quite like what #8217;s going on here. The vocals and some of the arrangement ideas. Was this recorded live? It sounds like the drums were recorded with room mikes with the levels set for when they are playing quietly and then when it gets rockier/louder it just becomes a bit of a mess. Either that or you are completely red lining the instruments on the mix - something that you generally should always try and avoid. I #8217;d suggest taking another go at the mix. Take all instruments down to 0. And then start with the loudest bit of your song and ensure none of it is clipping or in the red and work backwards to the quiet parts. I #8217;d also try shaving off some of the high frequencies on the vocal to get it to sit better in the mix and maybe a touch less reverb. There are loads of good books on mixing basics and also loads of free videos on YouTube. Or you can try one of these mastering services where you send off your track and they do it for you. Most importantly once you #8217;ve done that just release it and get it out into the world. So you can get working on some new stuff and develop your craft! Good work!

Are you recording the guitars with a mic by an amp or via simulated amp on recording software. It sounds like the former? And that the recording level is too high for the mic and you just get the warm mush of guitar sound. Now don #8217;t get me wrong distortion can be cool as a tool. But it sounds here like it may not be entirely intentional. I think the guitar needs more definition. The drums sound like they are being recorded with a room mic and therefore lack any bottom end etc. to fix that you need to closer mix the kit. Or an easier way to get a better quality end product would be use sounds in a DAW package. What software are you using to record? For example GarageBand has lots of good guitar sounds and drum loops etc you can use and manipulate very quickly easily to match your vision of what you want it to sound like.

Like it! Maybe a touch too much reverb on everything for my tastes (but suspect that may be a stylistic choice by you and/or the band). The stand out thing for me here was the vocals. Great rock voice. Reminds me of Joe Strummer belting it out! :)

I think I actually liked the video more than the song. But baffles me how you came up with that concept as the song lyrics I could pick out don #8217;t really tie into the visuals that I could see/hear. But kind of works! Lol! Good work!
You need to turn down some of your mixing levels. This is just flat lining and no dynamics.
I get the dark and the alternative but I don #8217;t think I #8217;d ever call this a pop song? It doesn #8217;t have the tempo or dynamics for that?

You seem to have the dream pop vibe down well. Liked the song. Thought the drumming was great apart from the shuffle in the first verse which seemed a bit too distracting for me. But great work. How did you make the video? Is that stock footage you used or did you shoot it?
I like the originality and I generally like dischordant stuff but the rhythm guitar on this just sounds plain out of tune?

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Large and in Charge [indie rock] (2011)
Like Beck or not like Beck?

WRITING.TEXT: Sounds like European music you #8217;d hear on holiday in Spain, Portugal etc. But instead of synth backgrounds you #8217;ve got a proper band doing the music. It #8217;s not really my style but it #8217;s definitely a distinctive style. And I #8217;m Not hearing any English bands that sound like it so that could be a good thing for you?

Is the quote at the start from a movie? The solo guitar at the start sounds bit out of time? And throughout the song there #8217;s something that really sticks out about it that I find a bit jarring. I #8217;m not sure if it #8217;s slightly out of tune, the effect you have on it or just the very high end tone? But doesn #8217;t sit well In the mix to my ears. When the band kicks in the rest of the recording sounds pretty accomplished. The vocals remind me of Ben folds five.

Sounds pleasant enough but seems to be too short to really be something mellow and ambient you can wallow in? Also it would be good to have some sort of thematic core which I think would generate more interest. As it is I find it a nice piece but frustratingly short. Not concise enough to be a pop song. Not long enough to luxuriate in!

This video looks crazy sophisticated! How did you put that together? Looks like it cost quite a lot of money! The music is not really my thing but the vocal is very distinct and unusual. Reminds me of nico from the velvet underground but with a euro pop backing. Not necessarily 2 things I #8217;d put together but who knows there could be a market for it? And if that #8217;s what your shooting for then I #8217;d say you #8217;ve hit the nail on the head! :)

Not 100% my thing but sounds very accomplished and can appreciate the inventiveness. Reminds me of St Vincent with the singing and a bit MIA with the cut up style. Where abouts in the world are you? And what kind of collaborators are you looking for?
Liked the music but couldn #8217;t really hear anything that reminded me of japanese music? #129300;
Sharing my thoughts and interested in other peoples.
Do you just troll?

Missed the fact that it was an instrumental and was expecting vocals to kick in for the first minute! Like the music but think it would benefit from vocals. Good classic indie vibe and good variation on the instrumentation.

Really like the start with the cut up stuttering guitar and drums and the song just gets better from there. The start very much reminds me of the flaming lips. Are they an influence for you? Very rare I hear something that ticks all the boxes on IMF but this song does. Is this a pro or amateur effort?

Liked the start of the tune with the drums and the guitar riff. But lost me with the singing sadly. Can #8217;t stand auto tune and it seems this has been auto tuned to death. Really like the first bit though.

Don #8217;t really hear the Arctic Monkeys comparison but can hear Mac Demarco. Some nice guitar work. The deadpan vocal at the start doesn #8217;t really work for me. But the vocal at the end of the song sounds really good. Listened to the 2nd track on your album and the same thing seemed to happen? I #8217;d stick to your upper register sounds way better.

For me the vocals might be a bit too high in the mix and with a bit too much reverb. Generally unless it #8217;s a stylistic/genre thing you should use an effect up to the point where it starts to draw attention to itself. And I think there #8217;s just a bit too much. The only other thing is I #8217;m not a huge fan of the guitar sound. Not sure if you #8217;ve captured that at source or whether that #8217;s an amp simulator? But might be worth trying a few other amp sounds if you can.

The only thing I #8217;d say is waiting 1:28 for the drums and stuff to properly kick in is asking quite a bit of the audience to stick around for. Particularly in the garage rock genre which is generally pretty immediate. If you are an established act it #8217;s easier but it #8217;s harder as a new artist.
Thanks for listening! #128077;

Nice. Original sounding. Guitars sound great. Reminds me a little of DIIV. Could imagine this being played in a skate video. Only criticism is the drums for me seem way to low in the mix. They are completely lost when the guitars come in. It may be worth dynamically riding the level of drums on your mix to ensure they are always cutting through and/or tweak your eq so that other instruments aren #8217;t covering up those drum frequencies. But good work! :)

The first bit with the ukulele reminded me of Sufjan Stephens and then when the music came in the vibe shifted. One thing I would say is that loads of people tend to post tracks on here where they are just playing ukulele and I generally switch off pretty quick. So suspect your song may suffer for the same reason (people switching off too early before the song begins proper). Nice voice.
Quite like the song but would love to hear the drum sample replaced with proper drums. Think it would benefit a lot. #128077;

Didn #8217;t think this would hold my attention as the drum and chords are well trodden tropes but I think the combination of the video, tongue in cheek lyrics and great feel kept me hooked. Captures a nice live feel really well. How long did it take you to put together the video?
Reminds me a lot of Mac DeMarco and Ariel Pink. It #8217;s not really a style I #8217;m a massive fan of but seems to be pretty well done. If that #8217;s what you were aiming for?

I like the song but feel neither version do it full justice. It would be good to hear a proper acoustic version with drums, bass etc. as for the bedroom pop version it seems a bit neither here nor there. The acoustic guitar sounds out of place with the instrumentation and style you #8217;ve chosen. I #8217;d get rid of it completely and work some of that time into those synth parts and/or try an electric guitar which may sit better?

In terms of feedback this mix has absolutely zero dynamics. If you look at the graphic volume display on SoundCloud it #8217;s flat out all the way through. And the sound quality really suffers as a result. If everything #8217;s just flat out nothing really sounds loud you just end up with everything sounding horrible. It would be good to hear a decent mix with some dynamics where you are choosing what you want to highlight at any given moment.

Liked the music very original and some nice ideas in there. I didn #8217;t realise it was instrumental so was disappointed when I realised the vocals weren #8217;t going to come in. Really like the stabbing rhythmic keys. Kept wanting to hear the guitar echo those stabs a bit. Thing that would be interesting and satisfying. But nice work!

Guitars sound great and really bright and airy. Vocals likewise with some great harmonies. Not typically a fan of this kind of stuff but couldn #8217;t help like your song. What did you use to record?

Something about the verse doesn #8217;t quite work for me. I think it might be the low fi dead sounding electric guitar. It sounds to me like the songs trying to be a pop song but this seems to hold it back? The chorus works really well and surprised me when it kicked in, changing the rhythms etc. Sounds like this is a programmed beat? Would benefit from a more live drum sound imho. But good work!

Congrats. Quite a strange song and that #8217;s meant in a good way. Like the way there #8217;s a real tension between the acoustic bits and when it rocks out. Like the emotion and the singing. The lyrics for me seem to get better as the song progresses. And the video is super cool. How long did that take? Presume that #8217;s the thing that cost the most? Or did you have the song professionally recorded as well? Good work.
Thank you! Glad you liked it! :)

Like the song, the production and your voice a lot. I take it all the noise at the start is an artistic choice? I #8217;m terms of the song two things that struck me, one the need for a bit more dynamics in the song as the vocal melody is very low and doesn #8217;t move around much, the second was in its present state whether it would benefit from being a bit shorter. Having said that greater dynamics might get rid of that problem. Great work!
Yep np
Hi had a listen. Not really my genre but sounds like the stuff that #8217;s in vogue right now. So good luck with it!
Awesome thanks!

I think the vocals sound good and you have a good voice. Just worth thinking about the dynamics of the song. Great example is Morrissey from the smiths. The vocal melodies tend to be very low and not move around much but it works because the music is very dynamic and also the ways he sings he tends to not follow traditional verse/chorus structures.

Thanks for listening and the great feedback. Agree this was a fairly early song from me. There #8217;s bits of it I like and some bits that don #8217;t so well. As you say the level of the guitar in the chorus is probably a bit to high! The guitar solo is really just scratching the strings with a pick! Lol! But I liked how it sounded! :)

Thanks :)

Would be cool to hear a #8220;studio #8221; version of this. But if you are planning to delete this post Covid then I guess that may or may not happen? Either way nice work. What did you use to record it?

Some really nice touches here. But think the song could be even better with a bit more of an organic feel. The looped guitar motif with lots of reverb is more a distraction for me than anything else. Would be cool to hear an acoustic version of this. Think early Bon Iver style if you are familiar with that?

Wonderfully evocative of the 80 #8217;s and Ariel Pink. I presume that #8217;s a very conscious thing? Would be interested to hear how you get the sound? Is it using 80s synths or the way you are EQing the music? Would be interesting to understand. But good work like the track. Seems crazy short though!

Like this song a lot. Was trying to see if you had some finished (non-demo) material but couldn #8217;t spot any. Also looked on Spotify but it seems you are not up there yet. But really like the sound and the song. Would just be good to hear a bit more of a polished studio version - but don #8217;t lose all the rough edges! Good work!

Nice work. The vocals reminded me a lot of Kim Gordon from Sonic Youth. Would have liked the song to have gone in the experimental noise direction but seemed to become more read rock as it progressed (particularly the end). But that #8217;s just a personal taste thing. For the most part like what #8217;s going on here. I #8217;d also edit the song to make it shorter. But like it. Good work.
Thank you for the feedback! Please upvote if you haven #8217;t already! :)
Thank you for the feedback! Don #8217;t think there are any diminished chords. What time I #8217;m the track are you referring to? Please upvote if you haven #8217;t already! :)
Thanks for the feedback! By pitchy do you mean out of tune?
Thanks for listening and the feedback. Please upvote if you can! Thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: Inspired by Radiohead: Novelistme - Love Capable

WRITING.TEXT: Definitely hear the Tame Impala vibe. Song sounds good. Only 2 things that jump out at me that don #8217;t work is 1) the very thing guitar tone - it sticks out way too much from the rest of the track. I think would benefit from a smoother distortion and muddying up a little bit. Also the background vocal oh-oh bit seems to loop on a bit too regular basis so as to draw attention to itself. I #8217;d perhaps use it less. But overall good sounds! :)

Started off with a very common chord progression on keys but interesting instrumentation kept my attention. And then the music went in a very different direction which was interesting. Would be interesting to hear with a proper vocal (not just backing vocal). But good work! :)

Like the vocal only intro but think it goes on for far too long - 1 minute before first verse. Like the music and the vocal and the vibe but the song seems to lack a catchy chorus. Was expecting some kind of revert to the intro vocal melody. I #8217;d say this is more of a cool album track than a single. Nice and mellow but not particularly hooky. Still good work!
Vocal melody is quite uncomfortable
Good energy. But I struggled with the guitar tone. Sounded like a DI guitar with some really bad distortion. Could be much improved with a more live sounding classic distortion tone.

Channels the spirit of Nirvana but manages to avoid parody and have its own unique vibe. Like the originality of the music and the vocals sound like something else! In a good way! Would be interesting to hear more.

Doesn #8217;t sound very shoegaze to me. Shoegaze tends to avoid classic rock guitar tropes (this is a pretty standard chord pattern) and have sweet choir boy vocals. I #8217;d call this more standard rock?

All my stuff is done in the box di but you can get some pretty good guitar tones with even basic stuff like GarageBand (what I use). A little reverb would also probably help so it #8217;s not quite so dry and in your face.

Thanks. I know what you mean re the beat. It #8217;s a precanned loop so not too much option to change. I #8217;ve never quite been able to put my finger on exactly what #8217;s out but... I kind of like it in a way. Adds a tension to things.! :)
Thanks for listening and glad you like it! :)
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! :)
Thanks for listening! The drums are a loop so was tricky to alter individual components. Never thought of using a compressor! Good idea!
Thanks #128077;
Thank you as always #128077;

WRITING.TEXT: Song sounds good on a quick listen but ruined by autotune. My reaction to autotune is almost a physical one. I can #8217;t listen to any song where I can hear it so had to sadly stop playing this. I don #8217;t understand the appeal of this effect at all.

The song was pleasant enough but something about the production didn #8217;t sound quite right to me. The vocals sound super high fidelity but the guitar sounded very wooly and flooded with reverb. And the drums also sounded like they were very reverb heavy. As a result the overall sound picture seemed confused. Generally speaking I think you want to have all elements of the music sounding like they are happening in the same physical space?

The sound of the guitar and your voice remind me of Jeff Buckley which is very high praise. However the song and the music didn #8217;t capture me. Would be interesting to hear with a bit more traditional music / chord voicing.

Yep couldn #8217;t really say it reminds me of anything. And that #8217;s a good thing as far as I #8217;m concerned. Some interesting musical choices that I liked. The drums for example. Sounded like it #8217;s own vibe. I could see this being a good album track but at 6 mins for a new listener that #8217;s asking a hell of a lot for such a low tempo track. I liked what I heard but even then I couldn #8217;t last the whole 6 mins.

Had low expectations based on the art work but was pleasantly surprised by the music. Like what you are doing. Only thing I #8217;d suggest is fixing that art work. Don #8217;t feel it really serves how good your music is.

WRITING.TITLE: One of very few Acoustic songs I #8217;ve recorded. Would welcome peoples thoughts and feedback! Novelistme - Baby You Want to Know

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening! #128077;
100% agree.
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. Please give it up an upvote if you have a second. Thanks.
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. 100% correct on solo creation. Please give it up an upvote if you have a second. Thanks. :)
Thank you :)

Hi thanks for listening. 1) the loops a commercial loop I used. There #8217;s something a bit strange about it. I know what you mean but I #8217;m not sure it #8217;s an imperfection I think it #8217;s deliberate. 2) there #8217;s a bit of discord in one of synth lines. I did try taking this out but just following normal blues/pentatonic/major scales just sounded dull. I #8217;m not sure I #8217;d describe it as out of tune (on that basis a bunch of musical styles would be classed as out of tune). It #8217;s more of an artistic choice. Personally the tension between different melodic lines is one of the things I like about it. But thanks for the feedback. Good to hear different thoughts and ideas. #128077;
Thanks for listening! There #8217;s 4 albums to date and one in the final stages of being finished. Please have a listen if you fancy it! :)

The acoustic bits sound very good. Nice vocals, nice drumming touches. Was wondering how this could be labelled indie rock and then a bit of electric guitar kicked in. For me the sound of the rockier bits didn #8217;t work as well as the acoustic. But like the imagination and variety you were shooting for. #128077;

Interesting song. Clearly using a lot of classic blues rock tropes and chord progressions. When the vocals kicked in was pleasantly surprised by the voice that for me seemed to have more depth to it than the songs and riffs. Reminded me of Mark Lanegan. Would be interesting to know what you were shooting for? Classic Rock ZZTop/Black Keys style or something a bit more original. If the former pretty successful despite a slight disconnect between the mood of the music and that of the vocals. If the latter then definitely would be interesting to hear a bit more deviation from classic blues riffs/sounds/progressions.

Super chill acoustic vibes nicely captured. Too many acoustic songs on here that all sound alike. However this nicely has its own vibe and unique sound. Also has the sense of a band playing rather than just relying on the one guitar. Good work.
Thanks #128077;
Nicely recorded and good vocals but the song itself didn #8217;t grab me.
What #8217;s the concept?

Sounds like a very well played and sung classic rock song in the AC/DC style. Whilst guitars sound good on their own and the whole thing swings quite nicely it still sounds like a DIY recording rather than a professional recording - albeit a hifi one. I suspect this may be done to the EQing and effects in that it sounds like all instruments were recorded separately and then have been treated separately. As a result none of them sound like they are in the same sound space. Also the vocals to me sound like they need dirtying up. So you might want to try putting the vocals through some kind of mild distortion and then mixing that with your clean vocal until you get a blend that works. Also you might want to consider rolling off some of the high frequencies?
Reminds me of artic monkeys from a vocal perspective. Not really my thing but can appreciate it #8217;s recorded well and everything sounds quite pleasing.

Was expecting a song rather than an instrumental for some reason. Sounded nice enough. My one criticism is that it #8217;s just slow and the rhythm just seems to drag. You might want to try and make the drums swing a bit more instead of what it #8217;s doing at the moment. Or increase the tempo. I just found it frustratingly dragged.

Liked the atmospherics and could definitely hear the Radiohead influence but the sound of rain just sounded too obvious cheesy. Also don #8217;t think the song itself was at the same level as the synth / atmospheric touches.
Thanks for listening and the positive feedback. Can #8217;t claim much credit for the drum sound as they are loops but the rest is all me! :)
Thanks for listening and the positive feedback! :)

Thanks for listening and the positive feedback. Glad you liked it! Took me a while to come up with the idea for the M8 so glad you think it works! I don #8217;t think there #8217;s any synth parts on this song though? It #8217;s just guitars with effects! :)

Thanks for listening and the positive feedback. Interesting feedback. Typically I #8217;ve been working on the assumption that you use either delay or reverb but never really lots of both - I #8217;d have thought it could get a bit muddy? But will have to have a play around. I did roll off the top end eq on most of it. One thing that always jumps out at me on most home recordings vs professional is that there #8217;s just so much high end stuff that doesn #8217;t really serve a purpose. To my ears most pro recordings (particularly in the 60s/70s limit that high end quite a bit - I think this plays to the #8220;warmth #8221; people talk about when they listen to vinyl. That #8217;s my take anyway! Everything here is recorded and mixed in GarageBand FYI. Have been thinking about moving to logic but love the simplicity and speed of GB. So haven #8217;t motivated myself to move yet!
Awesome thank you. The newest album is subject250 and just working on the 5th at the moment. Hope to have that finished in the next month or so!
Thanks for the feedback. Sorry to hear you didn #8217;t like the break - it #8217;s one of my favourite bits! ;)-
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. What wanted to check what you mean by balanced?
Well I guess that #8217;s not a well trodden path! Good luck!
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. ! I think you #8217;re the first person to spot the Phoenix influence! :)
Thanks for listening glad you liked it!

I think the spoken lyric as there wasn #8217;t much of a melody to really hold onto. In Radiohead you always have quite a strong falsetto holding things together from a melody perspective. It would be interesting to post the track minus vocals in a few weeks to see how people respond. I think the music may work better like that?
Thanks for listening!
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it!
Thanks for listening glad you liked it! :)

Hearing that guitar sound a lot on here recently. That and the production sounds like Mac De Marco and Ariel Pink to me. Everything sounds well recorded apart from there #8217;s something about the vocal that is a bit problematic for me. Not sure if there #8217;s just too much bass in the vocal (in which case just roll of a bit on eq) or whether it just needs a bit more compression? Presumably to get that retro sound you are just rolling off a lot of the high frequencies across everything?

Good work. The song pulls off all the classic rock tricks to good effect. The only thing that doesn #8217;t quite work for me is the vocal which sounds a bit out of place imho. It #8217;s good voice but too good to really sit with the music. At the very least I #8217;d try and dirty it up by putting through a distortion effect or something. But at the moment seems like an opera singer has walked on stage to Metallica. Which is interesting but....
Same way as on txt! :)
Thanks for listening and the feedback. Never thought about the Clap Your Hands compare but I get what you mean. #128077;
Thanks for listening and enjoying your baking! ;)-

Thanks for listening and the great feedback. What kind of ear candy are you thinking? I definitely need to work on counter melodies / harmonies a bit more. The vibe I was going for here was strokes like. So wanted to get the balance between raw but #8220;sweet #8221; as in poppy.
Gotcha
Thank you
