WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening glad you liked it!
Thanks for listening glad you liked it! When I was writing it I kind of had a doors vibe in mind! I think that #8217;s what you maybe heard?
Thanks for listening glad you liked it! I think one of the bits I like about it is that release bit. #128077;
Thanks for listening glad you liked it! The drums are looped so difficult to do much with tempo variation. So opted for the taking the music and melody somewhere else. #128077;
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! The Doors were a conscious influence on the music. I don #8217;t think it sounds like a Doors song but is definitely influenced! #128077;
Thanks for listening glad you liked it.
Thank you
Thanks
Thanks for listening and the feedback!
Thanks for listening and glad you got the intended 60s vibe! :)
Thank you!
The instrumental art of the song reminds me of air (the French band). When the vocals kick in it sounds very 80s as you say. Reminds me of OMD.

I hear a bit of Talking Heads in the guitar. The vocal has a relaxed charm to it. The backing vocal was a bit unexpected. Sounds like pretty straight guitar pop to me as opposed to anything particularly #8220;art pop #8221; as such. But good work enjoyed listening to it.

Like the tune and the melody of this but the production is too murky for me. Everything just seems a bit lost in reverb. It would be good to hear a more conservative mix that had a clearer focus. The song reminds me a lot of Coldplay in its drive and sense of melody. On that basis the distorted guitars that chug in at one part of the song sounded a bit out of place to these ears. But was impressed with the overall thing. With a bit more refinement think this could be very good.
Congrats on a good tune. Reminded me of Dear Science era TV On The Radio. Your text description made me expect something morbid but the song was a lot better than I expected.

Was expecting something a lot more rocking. Whilst the guitars are mildly distorted and the vocals are lofi I think you #8217;d be better off with a different description. In My experience rock fans tend to like things harder. I #8217;d call it more lofi pop.

Definitely hits the synthpop brief but I #8217;d probably say too slow for disco? Am I right in hearing auto tune in the vocal? I #8217;m allergic to auto tune! But it #8217;s clearly very popular! Good work irrespective!
Not sure that low monotonous vocal works for me. Would like to hear some energy in the vocal to match the music. Would be interesting to hear what your voice sounds like in a higher register?
Good distorted guitars and riff. Reminded me a bit of The Cult at the start before then becoming a bit more trad rock AC/DC when the verse starts.

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Slacker (Lie Lie Everybody) - This is my most streamed track on Spotify. As I write this I #8217;m 13 plays short of that elusive 1000 plays landmark! So please take a listen and help me get it over the line! :)

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening. It was quite a tricky one to sing and mix. There #8217;s a blend of high and low parts that combined are a little muddy. But when separated our didn #8217;t sound as good. So this was the best compromise I could come up with after many tries! Lol! I #8217;m kind of surprised this turned out to be so popular but it #8217;s always hard to gage what other people will like / dislike!
Thanks for listening and the feedback!
Thanks for listening and the feedback!
Reminds me of 80 #8217;s vibes and the psychedelic furs pretty in pink. The vocals remind me a bit of talking heads. What did you use to record? Keep it up!

10/10 for creativity. It #8217;s always good to hear something a bit different. Whilst I #8217;m a fan of discordant noise i think the best tracks and bands do a good job of marrying that with some kind of attractive pop hook that keeps you engaged. I think that #8217;s what this is missing. I #8217;m thinking of bands like sonic youth that tread this line very well. Good work though!

Like the song and the video. The mix / production values could be much improved. The vocals sound very dull and could benefit from some kind of sparkle (echo/reverb/delay/eq)? How did you do the video? And what did you use to record the song? Great work.

Like aspects of what #8217;s going on here. Really like the vocal sound. The guitar sound is very lofi. And the drum machine very minimal. I kept expecting things to kick into life and go a little bit hifi at some point but that didn #8217;t really happen. Also in my opinion there was way too much reverb later on in the song. For me the thing could be much improved with more dynamics and a bit of a sweeter sound.
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! #128077;
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it! #128077; I get what you mean. I think this song works best in the context of the album. Not really an attention grabbing single but...
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked the instrumental bit at least. I tried numerous times to redo the vocals but couldn #8217;t improve on this fairly raw take!
Thanks #128522;

Reminds me a lot of Jack Johnson. Very mellow vibes. Not really my thing but can appreciate it. Only thing I didn #8217;t like was it sounded to me like there was autotune on the vocal which jarred against the #8220;natural #8221; vibe?

I like the riff and the vibe but the performance itself isn #8217;t really tight enough. The timing of the guitar is out at various bits. From a production perspective you could make this less obvious by going for a less dry sound (run it through an amp, distortion, reverb etc.) as guitar is too upfront in the mix. Are you planning on adding more? Vocals etc?

Like the rough and ready nature of this and the fact it #8217;s short sharp and impactful! Like what you #8217;ve done with the voice. Is that just loads of echo turned on when you finish each vocal line? Nice effect. #128077;
Nice guitar sound. And the vibe of the video fits the song really well. Good work. What did you use to record this?
Music reminds me of QOTSA and vocals a bit of Metallica. But sounds good from both a performance and production perspective. Good work. #128077;

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - Problem (This is my second track to have crossed the 1000 Spotify plays threshold. Interesting it #8217;s so popular as it #8217;s ABCA structure with 2 verses and 2 different back to back choruses (neither of which repeat) is quite unusual. Thanks for everyone #8217;s support!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening and glad you like it. Hoping the new album will be ready to go in a few months. Just at the mixing/mastering stage! :)

Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. So the drums are loops but everything else was recorded by me in my apartment in Brooklyn (have since moved back to London). It #8217;s funny the riff is very basic and repetitive but seems to work nicely.
Hi thanks for listening and glad you liked it. Had a listen to your stuff. Sounds very smooth and jazzy. The vocals remind me of tricky. Good work.

I think my ear is probably over sensitive to any form of autotune as I really dislike it. I #8217;m of the old school. If it #8217;s not right just do another take. And you can generally Comp a good take from a few different attempts. I #8217;m pretty sure if you analyzed most classic records the singer wouldn #8217;t be pitch perfect all the time.
Cool thanks :)
Voice and music sound well recorded. The songs a bit one dimensional for me but would like to here other stuff that takes a few more musical risks.

First of all the video and song production are all first rate. The song itself isn #8217;t my kind of thing but I can appreciate it #8217;s well put together and the vocals sound good. Interested in how you recorded and mastered the song? And also how you filmed the video? Good work.

Nice guitar riff. And the guitar sound is good. The vocal effect I #8217;m not such a fan of but I suspect your going for that washed out sound quite deliberately? In terms of genre I wouldn #8217;t call it rock as at no point does it get rocky. Interested to hear how you recorded this? At home? In a studio? Good work.

The vocals and guitars sound good but the drums seem out of kilter with the rest of the track? Are they programmed or looped? Seem to me to be pulling in a different direction to the song which is a bit distracting. How did you record this?

The opening guitar seems very ornate. And then reverts to just basic acoustic chords. The acoustic guitar doesn #8217;t sound that well recorded and there doesn #8217;t seem to be enough going on for me. Later In the song when the electric comes back in it works better. Interested to hear what you used to record this?
Can appreciate this is very well put together although the song itself isn #8217;t really my thing. What did you use to record? Good work.

Really liked the intro. Sounded rocky and moody. But then when the verse lightened up and used that kind of jokey stabbing rhythm with the keyboard it lost me. The start reminded me a lot of Ty Segall who I love. But appreciate this may be just a personal taste thing. The recording sounds good though. What did you use? Good work.

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - 62 Sound - My attempt at fusing Indie with Motown! Let me know what you think?

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening and the feedback! #128077;
Thanks for listening and the feedback #128077;
Thanks for listening and the feedback. I think the bass is pretty dry? But some slap back echo on the guitar is interesting. #128077;
Thanks for listening and glad you liked it! #128077;

Sounds a very solid production. You #8217;ve definitely captured the indie vibe well and the playing seems tight. The stand out from the track for me was the drumming. Sounded good and the energy really drove things along. In terms of things to improve I thought the music was a little basic and felt a bit over familiar. And whilst the vocals were good the way they were mixed sounded more #8220;live #8221; than on the record. Might be interesting to play with different effects to see if you can get it to sit in the mix a little better (compression, roll off some of the highs on the eq, a bit of stereo delay perhaps)? Worth playing around with. How did you record this?

Vocals sound great. And the musical riff really works nicely. I take it this is a guitar sound on a synth? I agree with one of the other comments here that you #8217;ve nailed the bedroom pop vibe. What did you use to record it?

Sounds very professionally recorded. Sounds like you are going for the 60 #8217;s psych vibe here. Would normally say to tone down the reverb on the vocal but if that #8217;s the sound you are going for it #8217;s kind of a hallmark. Like the songs off kilter vibe. Presume this is a band effort? Love the picture. What is that? How did you record it?

The guitar riff was nice. But was hoping some drums would kick in and the song would take off. The glitchy drum kit gets a bit wearing after a while. And there #8217;s no bass at all to hold things together (no bass guitar or bass freq in the drum kit). I liked how it started but feel the track didn #8217;t live up to its potential.

Sound and song are cool. Loved the mellow opening. For me it sounded like the drums and vocals were a bit too loud in the mix. And there were too much effects on the vocals for my liking. The mix got in the way of the song for me rather than took it to the next level. But great work regardless. How did you record it?

Thanks for the feedback and glad you liked it. The drums are a loop so I didn #8217;t have too many options to vary it up unfortunately. Although a general trait of disco records is a pretty consistent beat throughout. However would have been good to drop certain bits out etc. thanks again!
Thanks for the feedback and glad you liked it. The drums are loops so I didn #8217;t have too many options to change / vary it unfortunately.
Thank you! :)

Like it. Good guitar riff. Catchy chorus. Nice balance of instruments dropping in and out to keep things interesting. My only suggestion would be I think the songs that good that I want to see it go somewhere else - and have an interesting M8. The sub 3 minute run time feels like it doesn #8217;t quite live up to its full potential. Good work though! How did you record it?

Great riffage, vocals, song and video. Really like the way you #8217;ve captured the energy of the track. How much time did you spend in the studio on this track? And video looks very professional. Congrats!
Thanks for listening and the feedback! Glad you liked it!
Thanks for listening and the feedback! Glad you liked it!
Thanks for listening and the feedback! Glad you liked it!

Thanks for listening and the feedback! Glad you liked it! In terms of performing it live: up until now all the Novelistme stuff is just me playing stuff on GarageBand. I guess the drums would just be a loop and everything else is pretty basic. Would require a few people doubling up the vocals on the chorus but don #8217;t think it would be too difficult.
Thanks for listening and the feedback! Glad you liked it! The octaves bit is really because I #8217;m not great at singing more complex harmonies! Lol!
Thanks for listening and the feedback. Glad you liked it!
Hopefully one day! :)
Thanks for the feedback, glad you liked it. :)
Thank you! :)
Thanks for listening! Will have to check out Chromeo! New album coming soon! :)

Amazingly slick production. How did you record it? I can picture the song getting regular radio play. It #8217;s not quite my type of thing but I can appreciate it. In terms of constructive criticism I #8217;m not sure the lyrics really lend themselves to a duet? I found the two voices a bit of a distraction.

Song was cool. Liked the vocals. But found that the keyboard accompaniment with just drums seemed a bit sparse to me. Would liked to have heard some other stuff going on. How did you record the vocals?
Sounds quite muddy to these ears. Lots of stuff overlapping in the mids?
Mix sounds very messy. I think the song underneath is kind of interesting but the mix distracts from that for me. Is this recorded live?

The guitar riff is cool. Although it reminds me of something quite a lot. Liked it when the chorus kicked in. Not convinced by the mix. I think perhaps too much effect on the vocal in the verse. Seems to work better in chorus. But overall quite like it. #128077;
Yep the title gets your attention and the song is pretty accomplished as is the video. How did you record this? I take it you #8217;ve done a fair amount of previous recording?
This is definitely not shoegaze!
Yep the vocals are out of tune which made it hard to appreciate the other parts which sounded ok.
Nice drum sound. Nice guitar part. Vocals interesting. Chorus was interesting and quite unexpected. Not sure it 100% works but appreciate the inventiveness. #128077;
Great work! What program are you using?

The drums are loops so was somewhat constrained there, but agree more variation would be good. Like you I think the instrumental interludes work well. I think it works quite well as an album track but not so much on its own as a single. Thanks for your feedback.

WRITING.TEXT: Hearing Weezer type vibes. Not 100% my thing but sounds a solid effort. Presuming the drums are loops? What did you use to record?

Interesting. The music definitely fits the shoegaze style but the voice brings a different vibe to it (which is cool). I guess a lot of shoegaze music has #8220;choir boy #8221; vocals so a Female voice sounds quite original and unique with this backing. Although the voice itself sounded very dry especially when all the other instruments are drenched in reverb and delays. Although saying that - that might also add to the uniqueness. So is this a band or a solo effort? What did you use to record? A x
Interesting music. Wouldn #8217;t describe it as krautrock myself - struck me as way too jazzy for that. But interesting none the less. What did you use to record? Good work!

Nice guitar work and sound. Reminds me of Sufjan. Whilst the guitar sound is #8220;true #8221; it sounds like a home recording. Largely down to the fact (I think) there #8217;s no compression on the guitar and the dynamic range is way more than you #8217;d get on a pro recording (they #8217;d take out some of the highs and lows). Might be interesting to hear a remix trying some of those ideas out? But good work!

WRITING.TEXT: Keep it up. Interested to hear what comes next! :)
Thanks #128522;
Thanks #128522;

Interesting. Not what I expected to hear when I click on alternative rock as it sounds very electronic. Reminds me a lot of Depeche Mode. At first wasn #8217;t sure but it grew on me. The mixing sounds pretty good. Lots of clarity. The one thing that didn #8217;t work for me was the account of guitar solo which stuck out like a sore thumb as everything else was so heavily treated. I think this also needs an equal level of effect to sit properly in the mix? But good work!

Like the song and the video. Some thoughts on the mix. Vocals could do with some of the high end taken out. Drums could be louder (maybe with a verb). The bass guitar could with more bass. But overall like it. Lots of nice stuff going on.
Not usually a fan of most acoustic efforts here but this is a bit different. Reminds me of nick drake who I love and the quality of recording is great! What did you use? Great work!
I wouldn #8217;t call this garage rock. Too soft and mellow.

Nice ambient guitar sounds and overall production. Not sure the song/tune itself is all that strong but can see potential. The rhythm of the track sometimes seems a bit awkward. Are these lives drums or programmed? What did you use to record this?
All pretty subtle mastering stuff. Have you tried running the finished track through a compressor and/or multi compressor?
What software are you using?
Thanks! The cover is a photo I took on my iPhone at a Tame Impala gig at Alexandra Palace a few years back. #128077;

Thanks! This started out as a bit of a spontaneous jam. I tried redoing it with a bit more variation but it lost the feel of the first attempt so stuck with that! Agree a key change would have been good! #128077;

Great screamo vocals. Like the video. The verse riff reminds me of the original batman riff. The distorted guitars kick in nicely. The only criticism is that it gets very repetive and old quite quickly. I #8217;d like to hear a change up after maybe 2 verses? But that #8217;s just my opinion. Good work!

Nice vocals with the paired high and low voices. Song is pretty pleasant without really grabbing you. Nicely recorded and mixed. Perhaps guitar chords are a bit loud in the mix? What did you use to record and mix?

Always risky with a long intro that people will tune out before the song kicks in proper. I didn #8217;t feel the intro really added much to the song. Voice, music and production sound pretty accomplished but the song itself didn #8217;t really grab me. What kind of bands/styles are you shooting for? How did you record? Good work! :)

Some interesting sounds. At first I thought this intro is going on too long but then I realised the intro is really the whole song! Needs more going on and some musical changes for me. That said I quite like the musical idea for say 30 seconds but beyond that it #8217;s just too repetitive for me.
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it!
Thank you #128591;
Thank you! :)
The intro conjures up the Beatles and Beach Boys for me. The music and guitars sound great. The lead vocal for me however isn #8217;t quite as strong. But good work. What did you use to record this?
The verse and vocals sound great. With really good quality production. However when the guitars kick in I don #8217;t think they sound quite as good. Good work. What did you use to record?

If you are aiming for that 60 #8217;s/70 #8217;s vibe is strongly suggest either shaving a lot of the top end off the keyboards or putty it through some mild distortion to dirty it up a little bit and make it sound more analogue. At the moment sounds too digital. Intrigued as to why there #8217;s no drums? Really think they #8217;d benefit the track.

Vocals remind me of rufus wainright. Singer can clearly sing. And production is very impressive. Can definitely hear a bit of the killers. Hard to really comment on what could be improved. I guess the song itself is good without absolutely me grabbing me. But still better than 99% of stuff I #8217;ve heard on here. Just a case of keep working and refining your craft.

The guitar and atmospherics reminded me a lot of Radiohead although the vocal and lyrics seemed to pull in another direction. Production sounded great. Interested to know what kit you used to record? Good work.
Thanks for the feedback. Glad you liked it!
Thank you

WRITING.TEXT: Thought the intro guitar was a bit shakey but then when the other instruments came in sounded a lot better. Vocals sounded good. Video was cool - what did you use to put that together? Also keen to hear what you used to record it? Good work.

Quite like the guitar riff, the vocal and the song. But the guitar sounds very in your face and not in a good way. Definitely has that home recorded vibe. Not sure if that was what you were going for? Sounds like it would benefit from some EQ and compression. Was there a bass guitar in the mix? If there was I couldn #8217;t hear it. Might also be nice to add some additional vocals for ear candy. Good work.

Nice use of muffled vocals at the start. Reminds me of weezer. Vocals worked well. Think the bass would benefit from doing something a little different to following the guitars. Over all pretty accomplished sounding. What did you use to record? Good work.

Like it. Reminds me a lot of Sonic Youth and Thurston Moore. Some really nice use of atmospherics. Would like to have heard it develop into some distorted roar at some point but liked what you did with it. A bit more of a crescendo would probably work better as a single but can see this being a great album track. What did you use to record? Good work!

Like the sounds. Sounds kind of original which these days is hard to do. The riff is good but feel the song itself abs structure needs work(seems a bit of an after thought). The vocals remind me a lot a few slacker 90s bands. Kind of reassuringly familiar. What did you use to record? Good work!

WRITING.TITLE: Novelistme - It's Hard (To Be in Love)

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for listening and glad you liked it. The drums are loops so not too much I could do there. And I #8217;m a guitar playing playing bass (so still finding my way with that instrument). But glad you liked the overall song. #128077;

Hi thanks for the feedback. Glad you liked it. Agree with you on the volume. This was done before I really got my head around compression and mastering techniques. Just working on a new album at the moment where I think/hope I #8217;m doing a better job! Hope to have that finished and out in the next 4 weeks ago. If you #8217;d like to hear that please follow on Spotify! :) The Strokes are definitely an influence but more so on some of my other songs. This one has been most likened to QOTSA. Not sure if you #8217;d agree? Thanks for listening!
Thanks for listening. Hope you like it. New album coming soon! :)
Thanks for listening! Glad you liked it. New album coming soon!

A very accomplished song. You #8217;ve captured the energy real well. Nice guitars. The vocals are original and interesting. Good drums - are they loops/programmes beats or live? The only criticism would be I think the mix could be improved. The vocals sounded a bit out of place with the rest of the music in terms of the effects that were on them. To these ears didn #8217;t quite sit in the mix. But other than that great work! :)

Good 80s vibe as people mentioned here. Are you planning to put vocals to it at any point? I think it would benefit. In terms of your comments re people being fake if you approach people with that pre conception you #8217;ll always see that from the biased view point. Have an open mind and be more generous with people. And I #8217;m sure you #8217;ll find good vibes coming back at you.

Guitar sounds awfully thin. As there #8217;s not much else going on that makes this fairly hard to listen to. The voice in the vocal sounds pretty good but the song itself doesn #8217;t hold interest unfortunately. Although the playing sounds fine it just needs more to pull you in.

The guitar intro was nice and held my interest but I #8217;m afraid when the vocals kicked in it lost me. Up until then the song had promise but for me when I heard them it sounded like the song lost its ambition to be something really good. Would be good to hear a version with proper clear vocals.
The intro showed promise. The psychedelic video also. But then in the middle there just seems to be a lot of wailing some of which was pretty out of tune which just lost me unfortunately.

The production values on the song sound really good. Was this done in a proper studio with a producer? Likewise the video is clearly very well done. I suspect must have taken quite some time. The song itself is nice enough without really grabbing me but appreciate the craft gone into everything!
Don #8217;t worry about genre just go where the music takes you!
Hi there. I #8217;m referring to the effects applied to your voice rather than the voice itself.
Awesome glad you liked it. If you like that you may like the rest of the album which has a similar vibe. #128077;
Thanks for the feedback. Glad you liked it. Have heard from some people it reminds them of franz Ferdinand but not LCD. But like LCD a lot so definitely a compliment! #128077;

WRITING.TITLE: Someone just compared this song of mine to early LCD Sound system. I #8217;m a big fan but hadn #8217;t previously made this connection. What do you think? Novelistme - Come On In
